w:r.w:t: The student will be introduced to the different play actions in this lesson. Knowing different activities are key verbs that the student needs to know to help with describing different things and building an English vocabulary. The student will learn how t
o pronounce and spell different actions. The student will learn how to describe different actions using words they learned already in previous lessons. The student will respond in complete sentences.
At completion of this lesson, student will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words different actions students take while playing.
Spell and pronounce commonly associated words.
Word List: kick, run, outside, inside, jump, ball, action, sit
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.

words for the actions on the slide: Run, jump, sit, play

Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide Number 21
Student should have a blank slide to draw a picture of different actions.
kick, run, outside, inside, jump, ba
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent the different actions through pictures. One prompt at a time.

Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity Slide Number 22

kick, run, outside, inside, jump, ball, action, sit
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
